content: In TensorFlow, is there a way to modify the default port (6006) on TensorBoard so that multiple TensorBoards can be opened? Is there an option similar to `--port="8008"`?

Yes, you can modify the default port for TensorBoard using the `--port` option. This allows you to run multiple instances of TensorBoard on different ports. You can specify the desired port number when launching TensorBoard from the command line.

For example, to run TensorBoard on port 8008, you can use the following command:

```bash
tensorboard --logdir=your_log_directory --port=8008
```

Replace `your_log_directory` with the path to your log directory. This command will start TensorBoard on port 8008 instead of the default port 6006.

You can open additional instances of TensorBoard on different ports by specifying different port numbers:

```bash
tensorboard --logdir=another_log_directory --port=8010
```

This flexibility allows you to monitor multiple training processes simultaneously by accessing them through different ports in your web browser.
